result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven W Shaw Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: any sentence being served

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not possess/consume alcohol or any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Court does not object to probation being transfered to Colorado.

timeConds.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Court authorizes transfer to Waukesha County Jail.

Disposition Form

Def in person & by Atty Anthony D Cotton.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  CASES CALLED:  15CF369, 15CM1015, 15TR2120.  Agreement reached w/free to argue re condition time.  State moves to amend Ct 5 to Misd Bailjumping, 946.49(1)(a); Court so orders.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 3, Ct  4, 15CM1015 & 15TR2120; Court so orders.  Def enters guilty plea to amended Ct 5.  Court finds def guilty on amended Ct 5.  Statements from State, counsel, def's grandfather, and def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  Def req expungement; Court denies request.
Arraignment at 01-13-2016 01:15 pm

Def in person & by Atty Anthony D Cotton.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Matter was set for preliminary hearing, however, def now waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court questions def and accepts waiver.  State files and Court reviews Information w/def.  Counsel anticipates resolution and req adj to January.  Arraignment scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 11-18-2015 08:30 am
Def in person & by Atty Anthony D Cotton.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Preliminary hearing requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Original signature by officer on complaint
No contact with Co-Defendant RS, direct or indirect; Not possess/use any controlled substance without valid prescription
15R 017415  Bond receipted at Clerk of Courts Office
Hearing at 10-14-2015 02:45 pm

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Christopher Ehrfurth as a friend of the Court.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: CP.    Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Def has pending Wauk Co case.  Court sets $1200 cash bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts waiver.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Counsel does not know if he will represent in this case. Hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
